original_title: Loss of freedom feared from online law, many do not know: survey
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – A bill that proposes to set up a commission to regulate what is said on social media will curtail freedom, respondents in a survey by Verete Research, a Colombo-based think tank has said, while a majority said they had not heard about the bill.
Only 34 percent of the respondents said they had heard about the bill.
Of those 56 percent said they it will reduce the freedom of social media, 25 percent said it will not make much difference, while 19 percent said it will reduce the mis-use of social media.
Sri Lanka’s Supreme Court has said that 31 clause of the bill were against the constitution.
The poll was based on an island-wide, nationally representative sample of responses from 1,029 Sri Lankan adults, conducted in October 2023, Verete said.
The poll has a maximum error margin below ±3 percent at a 95 percent confidence interval. (Colombo/Nov25/2024)
